Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a home run to lead off the first inning.
Ramón Urías hit a two-run double in the second inning.
Cedric Mullins scored when Buehler threw a wild pitch in the second inning.
Teoscar Hernández hit a home run in the fifth inning.
Ohtani and Betts pulled off a double steal in the fifth inning.
Gunnar Henderson couldn't field Gavin Lux's grounder in the fifth inning, allowing Ohtani to score.
O'Hearn's double scored Anthony Santander in the eighth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Orioles had a chance to tie the New York Yankees for the American League East lead with Corbin Burnes on the mound.
Manager Brandon Hyde emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Brandon Hyde acknowledged the team's defensive errors but noted Burnes' better performance compared to his previous outings.
Hyde expressed optimism about the team's recent performance and their ability to improve.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Orioles committed three errors for the third time this season.
Burnes allowed six runs, five of them unearned.
The game was postponed due to rain delays.
